page.title: 18GIRL GUIDES AND BOY SCOUTS
page.content: The old St.Patrick's Hall, remembered by capacity audiences as the venue for so many fine productions of plays written mostly by Irish authors,is now the meeting place for Boy Scouts and Girl Guides. Friday evenings from 7.30 pm to 9.00 pm sees the Scouts engaged in various games, activities and training, while on Tuesdays, during the same hours,the Guides are similarly occupied. Both groups have their annual camping holiday each summer, which is generally regarded as the highlight of the year's activities. The cost of this to each boy or girl usually works out between ten and fifteen pounds. The Scouts' uniform is predominantly blue and navy, while the Guides' is blue and brown.
